text: meatloaf is quite possibly my favorite
comfort food and probably yours too this
version uses dark meat turkey instead of
beef so it's still packed with flavor
but it's much healthier and equally as
delicious
the secret weapon in this recipe is
Chipotle's and adobo sauce it gives it a
little bit of a southwestern Flair
start with your meat in the bowl I have
two and a quarter pounds here of turkey
ground make sure it's the dark meat more
flavor and two slices of white bread
this is just your good ol sandwich bread
you don't need anything fancy here in
fact the soft white bread is really
ideal because it absorbs all of those
flavors and bakes up really well with
your meat mixture and to that salt one
and a half teaspoons kosher salt course
always and a half and worst assure this
is very common in Meat Loaf's and
hamburgers it imparts a lot of flavor
you'll need two teaspoons here you can
just sort of drizzle it over the mixture
because we're gonna mix it all up anyway
and pepper 1/2 a teaspoon freshly ground
always you could grind this into a bowl
and measure it but I just like to use my
eyeballs ok that looks good
and the adobo sauce 2 teaspoons a
Chipotle is just a dried and smoked
jalapeno pepper so it gives a similar
level of heat but with a nice earthy
smokiness and you'll find that you never
need an entire can of this good stuff at
once so transfer it to a Tupperware and
it'll keep in your fridge for a very
long time and an onion I like to use red
onion you could also use a sweet onion
or a white onion 3/4 of a cup is all you
need here minced and the mince is nice
and fine
so take your time the other way if
you're mincing your onions with a sharp
knife you won't have any tears I promise
you okay I think that looks like just
about 3/4 of a cup so that goes in
and you have to have a binder for your
meatloaf of course an egg does the trick
quite well give it a quick whisk and
then an unusual herb for a meatloaf
perhaps but it really works nicely with
the chipotles in adobo and that's
cilantro this is gorgeous cilantro I
have here still on the roots if you see
herbs on the roots I'm telling you that
is the way to buy it and these roots get
them nice and clean and you can chop
them up and saute them with your onions
or garlic in a recipe it imparts
excellent coriander flavor and the stems
are tender and perfectly edible too so
you can chop those right up with the
leaves not like parsley or sage or some
of those other herbs where you have to
remove the stems because they're too
tough these are tender and delicious a
casual chop you don't have to go too
fine here do they look like about half a
cup to you might be a little more but I
like cilantro so and it goes all of it
and fold this up now a little trick if
you have an Italian grandmother that
taught you how to make meatballs you
probably already know this but you don't
want to overwork the ground meat because
it can become tough so just use a gentle
folding motion you could also get in
there with your hands really we just
want to make sure that all of those
flavors are evenly distributed okay I
think that looks pretty good this just
goes into a loaf pan this is a 9 by 5 if
you have a nonstick you could use that
but you can also just spray a regular
loaf pan with nonstick cooking spray
transfer the mixture into your pan and
now this is almost ready for the oven
but we have one more step to do the
glaze that goes on top the glaze makes
the meatloaf two ingredients are all you
need for the glaze 1/2 a cup of ketchup
surely you have a jar of this in your
fridge
America's favorite condiment as I like
to call it and the Chipotle's from that
can of chipotle in adobo this is 2
teaspoons minced that'll be about one of
those little peppers in there and just
stir that about and all of this glaze
goes right over the top
mm-hmm-hmm just the smell of the ketchup
and Chipotle's together is pretty
convincing that this is gonna be a
delicious meatloaf and you can use a
brush if you'd like to just evenly
distribute the glaze they'll become hot
and bubbly and sort of melt down into
the
sides this just goes into a preheated
375 degree oven for about an hour and 15
minutes you want the meatloaf to
register 160 degrees on a thermometer
that's important because remember this
is Turkey and not beef so it can't be
under and then alongside it roast sweet
potatoes they'll finish up in about the
same amount of time then you'll have a
delicious sweet potato mash that pairs
beautifully with this turkey meatloaf
and those flavors of Chipotle and
cilantro now the reason you fork these
sweet potatoes is that if you don't they
could explode in your oven and nobody
wants that and I love these kinds of
dinners where you can do everything
together at once they start together and
finish together just the way it should
be makes your life a lot easier okay
into the oven our meatloaf is out of the
oven looking gorgeous and it's still hot
but do let it set up for a good 10 to 15
minutes before you slice it some lime
wedges the sweet potatoes you can see
have been mashed I just mashed them up
with olive oil salt and pepper and the
meatloaf you can just cut into slices as
you desire I'm hungry so I'm gonna do
nice thick slices here this is
definitely enough to feed six people I
would think this is a really easy meal
to pull together on a weeknight some of
that sweet potato mash onto the plate a
beautiful slice whoo I want this one
right from the center resting on the
mash and then I have this beautiful
cress here this is called upland cress
but watercress would work well too it's
a nice tender peppery green upland cress
is sold as a living green it's still got
its roots at the bottom and a drizzle of
oil a little bit onto your meatloaf and
your mash and then to finish it all a
squeeze of lime juice and there you have
it a beautiful and delicious anytime
meal happy eating
